1.Pros: Fun, fast paced experiences at times
1.Cons: Depending on location, it can be stressful

2.Pros: great way to learn fast paced skills. many opportunities to move up.
2.Cons: unorganized, rude customers, rude managers, ghetto, I remember 2 coworkers started fighting once and another customer had came in another time and smashed the supervisors head on the fridge

3.Pros: Flexible hours, good pay, nice people
3.Cons: Rude customers, lack of appreciation at times

4.Pros: learn a lot, lead teams, good first job
4.Cons: type of people who work here are sometimes not driven

6.Pros: discount food on break, Friendly regular customers

8.Pros: - Get a little authority without the responsibilities of being a manager- Possible discount and/or free meals depending on which store you work at- Very flexible hours. Especially useful if you are a student. Picking up and giving away shifts is often easy.
8.Cons: - The managers usually have 0 qualities of being a manager and it can be very frustrating at times- Proper training procedure is hardly ever used resulting in the trainer doing the job of two or more people depending on how many are being trained.- The customers are often rude.- Managers slack off a lot and sit in the office whenever they can.

9.Cons: Not worth the stress from customers or management
